title: Greater numbers of women are dying of alcohol-related conditions, study finds
description: A rising number of women are dying from alcohol-related deaths, a new study has found. Here are potential factors that could be driving up the health risk.

title: West Virginia revokes Alderson Broaddus' right to award degrees as school hemorrhages money
description: The financially struggling Alderson Broaddus University in West Virginia will be prohibited from awarding degrees effective December 31.

title: Paul Pierce talks racy video that led to ESPN dismissal: 'We all make some mistakes'
description: Paul Pierce talked about his dismissal from ESPN in the latest episode of "Stars on Mars" and lamented posting the racy social media video that led to his ouster.

title: Arkansas fisherman pulls 165-pound paddlefish onto shore: 'Fish of a lifetime'
description: An Arkansas fisherman saw a large fish floating in Beaver Lake and discovered a 165-pound paddlefish that had been hit by a boat, which severed the fish's spinal cord, officials say.

title: Bernie Sanders leads lawmakers demanding DOJ prosecute fossil fuel companies for climate change
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders and other left-wing lawmakers wrote to the Attorney General Merrick Garland, asking it to sue the fossil fuel industry for lying about climate change for years.

title: Pennsylvania allots $400M in federal funds for on-the-job infrastructure worker training
description: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro on Monday issued an executive order allotting up to $400 million toward organizations providing on-the-job training for new infrastructure workers.

title: DeSantis says Trump can't win in a general election: 'Those are just the realities'
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis explains why he is the best candidate to defeat President Biden in 2024 and why former President Donald Trump can't win in a general election on 'Special Report.'

title: Indiana shooting unfolded while police were calling venue to shut it down: report
description: A weekend shooting at a Muncie, Indiana, block party reportedly unfolded while police were attempting to call the owner of the venue and have the party shut down.

title: Senegalese government dissolves top opposition party, restricts internet
description: Patriots of Senegal for Work, Ethics and Fraternity (PASTEF) has been dissolved by the West African nation's government ahead of the 2024 election.

title: 'Euphoria' star Angus Cloud dead at 25: 'An incredible human'
description: "Euphoria" star Angus Cloud has died at the age of 25. His family tells Fox News Digital that Cloud's death comes as the actor struggled with the loss of his father.

title: South African political leader calls for violence against White citizens at rally: 'Kill the Boer, the farmer'
description: The leader of the South African Economic Freedom Fighters party, famous for his racially-charged rhetoric, called to kill the descendants of Dutch settlers at a recent rally.

title: Why Pee-wee Herman icon Paul Reubens kept his cancer battle quiet
description: 'Pee-wee's Big Adventure' co-star Mark Holton remembers his friend, Paul Reubens, on 'Fox Across America with Jimmy Failla'

title: Oklahoma Legislature overrides Stitt veto, upholds tribal tobacco compact
description: The Oklahoma Legislature on Monday overrode Republican Gov. Kevin Stitt's veto of a bill extending Native American tribes' tobacco sales compact with the state.

title: Jets' Aaron Rodgers on darkness retreat flak: Critics 'might benefit the most'
description: New York Jets star Aaron Rodgers opened up about the criticism he received over the darkness retreat he embarked on after the 2022 season.

title: Suzanne Somers reveals breast cancer returned: 'This is familiar battleground'
description: Suzanne Somers has battled cancer once again as she puts work on the "back burner" to focus on her health. The "Step by Step" star was diagnosed with breast cancer for the second time.

title: Mississippi woman found guilty of threatening federal judge with violent emails
description: A 41-year-old woman from Mississippi, Candra Clark of Ridgeland, has been found guilty of making threatening statements against a federal judge last year.

title: Princeton University student pleads guilty to joining mob's Jan. 6 attack on Capitol
description: A Princeton University student who was arrested by the FBI in connection with the U.S. Capitol riot, entered a guilty plea on Monday for his involvement in attacking police officers.

title: Pipeline operators agree to $12.5M payout for Montana, North Dakota oil spills
description: Belle Fourche Pipeline Company and Bridger Pipeline LLC will pay $12.5 million in a legal settlement over oil spills in Montana and North Dakota.

title: Boston suspect arrested for allegedly stealing car with toddler inside: police
description: Boston resident Cristofanes Mendes was arrested after allegedly stealing a pickup truck with a toddler inside in Dorchester on July 14. The child was returned after the theft.

title: Canada's Allysha Chapman goes on explicit tirade toward Australia coach, caught on hot mic
description: Canada's Allysha Chapman didn't mince words toward Australia's Tony Gustavsson after challenging Hayley Russo for the ball at the Women's World Cup.

title: Ohio police chief arrested in Florida after allegedly assaulting homeless man
description: Boston Heights Police Chief Chad McArdle was arrested in Florida after allegedly assaulting a homeless man. McArdle originally told police that he was attacked by two suspects.

title: Biden administration distances itself from Pentagon official who bashed UFO hearing
description: Top Pentagon official tasked with investigating UFOs ripped witnesses' testimonies during last week's "insulting" congressional hearing. The DoD said it was his personal opinion.

title: JT Poston misses out on $260,000 after risky play at 3M Open: 'We’re not coming here to finish second'
description: Two-time PGA Tour winner J.T. Poston risked it all for first place at the 3M Open tournament in Minnesota this weekend and instead lost out on an extra $260,000.

title: Virginia veterinary technician sentenced to 20 months for role in dogfighting scheme
description: A Virginia vet tech was sentenced to 20 months in prison in a dogfighting scheme. Prosecutors say Carlos Warren electrocuted the dogs when they would no longer fight.

title: Missing Indiana woman Andi Wagner's mother pleads for answers 1 year after disappearance
description: Andi Wagner vanished from Evansville, Indiana, around Aug. 6, 2022, when she was 24, and has not been heard from since. Her mother is pleading for answers nearly a year later.

title: Paul Reubens: ‘Pee-wee Herman’ actor’s life in pictures
description: "Pee-wee Herman" actor Paul Reubens died on July 30 following a battle with cancer, his rep confirmed. Here's a look at his life in pictures.

title: 15-judge bench to hear anti-judicial reform petitions, Israeli Supreme Court says
description: The Israeli Supreme Court on Monday said a full, 15-justice panel will hear petitions in September against a judicial reform law championed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Goldman Sachs senior analyst missing after attending NYC concert
description: Goldman Sachs analyst John Castic vanished Saturday after attending a concert at a Brooklyn music venue weeks after another man went missing from the same location, reports say.

title: USA vs Portugal: Everything you need to know about Women's World Cup match
description: The U.S. women's national team will look to move forward in the Women's World Cup with a win or a draw against Portugal. It might be easier said than done.

title: Devon Archer: Hunter Biden, Burisma execs ‘called DC’ to get Ukrainian prosecutor fired
description: Devon Archer testified Monday that Hunter Biden and Burisma executives “called D.C." in 2015 to get help from the Obama administration to fire a Ukrainian prosecutor.

title: Wisconsin judge drops GOP lawmaker's military voting records suit
description: A Wisconsin judge has ruled against Republican state Rep. Janel Brandtjen on Monday in a lawsuit over the recording of military absentee votes.

title: Jury to deliberate death penalty for Pittsburgh synagogue shooter Robert Bowers
description: A jury is set to deliberate a potential death sentence for Robert Bowers, a 50-year-old truck driver who killed 11 people at Pittsburgh's Tree of Life synagogue in 2018.

title: Devon Archer confirms Joe Biden 'lied' about knowledge of Hunter's business dealings, Comer says
description: House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer said testimony from Devon Archer "confirms" that President Biden "lied to the American people when he said he had no knowledge about his son’s business dealings and was not involved."

title: Nearly 400 Pakistani migrants rescued in eastern Libya from trafficking warehouses
description: Security authorities in eastern Libya conducted a successful overnight raid, freeing at least 385 Pakistani migrants who were being held in trafficking warehouses.

title: Iraq calls for Islamic Cooperation Committee to address Quran desecration in European countries
description: Iraq's foreign minister, Fouad Hussein, has urged the Organization for Islamic Cooperation to establish a committee for negotiations with the UN regarding the desecration of the Quran.

title: Kentucky education commissioner leaves for Western Michigan University job
description: Kentucky Commissioner of Education Jason Glass announced Monday that he will leave current role on September 29 in favor of a position at Western Michigan University.

title: Phoenix welcomes respite from record-breaking 31-day heatwave as monsoon rains arrive
description: After enduring a historic 31-day heatwave with temperatures over 110 degrees Fahrenheit in Phoenix, residents received some relief on Monday as monsoon rains from Mexico arrived.

title: Florida university fires professor over dubious racial bias studies, damage to school may be ‘catastrophic’
description: A Florida State University professor has been fired after the school claimed he had exercised "extreme negligence" in racial bias studies that were retracted.

title: Tommy McClelland appointed as athletic director at Rice University
description: Rice University announced that Tommy McClelland has been appointed as the new athletic director. McClelland joins Rice after serving as the deputy athletic director at Vanderbilt.

title: FAA investigating near miss between Allegiant airplane and private jet
description: Federal aviation officials announced on Monday that they are conducting an investigation into a recent close call incident involving an Allegiant Air plane and a Gulfstream private jet.

title: 'Improvised and atrocious': Italy looks to leave China deal, reversing decision of previous government
description: Italy plans to pull out of the controversial Chinese Belt and Road Initiative, Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto said during an interview released on Sunday.

title: 'Home Improvement' star Zachery Ty Bryan arrested again on domestic violence charges
description: Zachery Ty Bryan has been arrested on charges of domestic violence. The "Home Improvement" star previously pleaded guilty to domestic violence in 2020.

title: Cardi B accused of battery after flinging mic at fan during Vegas concert
description: Cardi B threw her microphone into the audience during a concert on Saturday, and now a police report about the incident has been filed, Fox News Digital can confirm.

title: UFO whistleblower, GOP lawmaker urge increased transparency on Pentagon's UAPs program: 'It's beyond belief'
description: Former Navy pilot Ryan Graves and Rep. Tim Burchett, R-Tenn. discuss the importance of creating a select committee on unidentified aerial phenomena (UAPs) and destigmatizing the topic.

title: Disgruntled CNN employees feel ‘grass is greener’ at rival NBC News, media insider says
description: Puck's Dylan Byers, who has worked at both CNN and NBC News, put a spotlight on an ongoing mass exodus of CNN staffers who have bolted for NBC in his Sunday column.

title: Barrel with body found at Malibu beach, California authorities say
description: Human remains were found stuffed in a 55-gallon drum Monday on a Malibu, California beach, authorities said. Police have yet to release any information on the identify of the body.

title: Florida suspect accused of attacking, spitting on woman holding a baby
description: Key West resident Jeanty Falando Altenor is accused of hitting and spitting on a woman who was holding an infant last week. The victim reported that three other kids were near her.

title: Ex-Auburn football player was locked in nasty custody battle before wife’s alleged murder plot
description: A Georgia woman is accused of plotting to have her wealthy husband murdered after he allegedly caught her cheating and filed for divorce, according to court papers.

title: Kerry ripped for demanding agriculture emission cuts: ‘Bankrupt every farmer in America’
description: Climate czar John Kerry was slammed on social media over a clip where he called for more regulations on the farming industry to combat climate change.

title: California parents sue over law preventing religious schools from using state funds for special ed students
description: The orthodox Jewish parents believe their children with disabilities should be permitted to use allocated federal funds at religious schools of their choice to provide the best education.

title: Georgia resident dies from rare brain-eating amoeba found in freshwater lakes
description: Georgia state health officials say a resident has died after becoming infected with Naegleria fowleri, a rare brain-eating amoeba, likely while swimming in a freshwater lake.

title: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones reveals position in Zack Martin contract holdout: ‘We need the money to pay Parsons’
description: Dallas Cowboys offensive tackle Zack Martin is looking to get paid, but owner Jerry Jones is focused on addressing other roster needs, including an extension for star edge rusher Micah Parsons.

title: Biden acknowledges 7th grandchild for the first time on-camera after repeatedly ignoring her existence
description: President Biden acknowledged his seventh grandchild, Navy Joan Roberts, for the first time on camera, finally speaking about her late last week after ignoring her for years.
